content.description: In sentence 2 (reproduced below), the writer wants an effective transition from the introductory paragraph to the main idea of the passage.
content.question: The culprit was a discrepancy in the software that controlled the spacecraft’s thrusters: one team of engineers had calculated the force needed from the thrusters in pounds, an imperial unit, while another team calculated the force in newtons, a metric unit.Which of the following versions of the underlined text best achieves this purpose?

choices.label: thrusters; the data from the spacecraft and the data from NASA’s computers on the ground had not been matching up for months since the launch of the Orbiter
thrusters—software that was used to calculate the trajectory the Orbiter needed to take in order to enter Mars’s orbit successfully
thrusters: four thrusters were used for trajectory correction maneuvers as well as pitch and yaw control, while another four were used for roll control

skill.text: Skill 6.B: Use transitional elements to guide the reader through the line of reasoning of an argument.
